Function.name: Abs
Function.description: Returns the absolute value (unsigned magnitude) of the decimal number 'n'.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number to extract the absolute value from.

Function.name: Mod
Function.description: Returns the remainder of decimal division of 'n' by 'm'.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The dividend in the modulo operation.

Parameter.name: m
Parameter.description: The divisor in the modulo operation.

Function.name: Power
Function.description: Returns 'n' raised to the power of 'm'.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The base value.

Parameter.name: m
Parameter.description: The exponent value.

Function.name: Round

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The Decimal number to round

Parameter.name: fractionalDigits
Parameter.description: Use it to specify the number of fractional digits that n has to be rounded to. The default value is 0. Note: In aggregates this parameter is not specified.

Function.Description:
Returns the Decimal number 'n' rounded to a specific number of 'fractional digits'.
The round method applied depends on where the function is used:
- In expressions in client-side and server-side logic, applies the method round half to even (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds to the nearest even integer).
- In aggregates that query SQL Server or Oracle databases, applies the method round half away from 0 (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds the number further away from 0).
- In aggregates that query MySQL or iDB2 databases, applies the method round half up (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds up).
Function.Examples:
When used in expressions in client-side and server-side logic:
Round(-10.89) = -11
Round(-5.5) = -6
Round(9.3) = 9
Round(2.5) = 2
Round(3.5) = 4
Round(9.123456789, 5) = 9.12346

When used in aggregates that query SQL Server or Oracle database:
Round(-10.89) = -11
Round(-5.5) = -6
Round(9.3) = 9
Round(2.5) = 3
Round(3.5) = 4

When used in aggregates that query iDB2 database:
Round(-10.89) = -11
Round(-5.5) = -5
Round(9.3) = 9
Round(2.5) = 3
Round(3.5) = 4

Function.name: Sqrt
Function.description: Returns the square root of the Decimal number 'n'.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number to calculate the square root from.

Function.name: Trunc
Function.description: Returns the Decimal number 'n' truncated to integer removing the decimal part of 'n'.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number to truncate.

Function.name: Max
Function.description: Returns the largest number of 'n' and 'm'.

Function.name: Min
Function.description: Returns the smallest number of 'n' and 'm'.

Function.name: Sign
Function.description: Returns -1 if 'n' is negative; 1 if 'n' is positive; 0 if 'n' is 0.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number from which to calculate the sign value.

Function.name: Chr
Function.description: Returns a single-character string corresponding to the 'c' character code.

Parameter.name: c
Parameter.description: The ASCII code value to be converted to a character.

Function.name: Concat
Function.description: Returns the concatenation of two Texts: 't1' and 't2'.

Parameter.name: t1
Parameter.description: The first string.

Parameter.name: t2
Parameter.description: The string that will be appended to the first string in the output.

Function.name: EncodeHtml

Parameter.name: text
Parameter.description: The Text to be encoded.

Function.Description:
Returns a string with all the reserved characters translated in order to be used in HTML literals.

Using un-escaped expressions without encoding distrusted variables (e.g. user input) compromises the end-user security by allowing HTML and JavaScript injection as well as cross-scripting. You should use this function when managing un-escaped expressions.

Function.name: EncodeJavaScript

Parameter.name: text
Parameter.description: The Text to be encoded.

Function.Description:
Returns a string with all reserved characters translated in order to be use in JavaScript literals.

Using un-escaped expressions without encoding distrusted variables (e.g. user input) compromises the end-user security by allowing JavaScript injection as well as cross-scripting.
You should use this function when managing un-escaped expressions.

Function.name: EncodeSql

Parameter.name: text
Parameter.description: The Text to be encoded.

Function.Description:
Returns a string where certain characters (for example single quotes ') are escaped.
To prevent the injection of malicious SQL statements use the EncodeSql() built-in function whenever you are using expanded inline Parameters that contain distrusted Variables (for example user input) that evaluate to string literals.
Do not forget to wrap the EncodeSql() function in single quotes, ', otherwise your query will still be vulnerable to SQL injection.

Function.name: EncodeUrl

Parameter.name: text
Parameter.description: The Text to be encoded.

Function.Description: Returns a string with all non-alphanumeric characters coded in order to be used in URL parameter values. Only alphanumeric characters [0-9a-zA-Z] can be un-encoded in the URL. For a matter of security, you should use this encoding function when managing URLs in your application. For example, when you want to add a dynamic URL to an external site.

Function.name: Index

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The Text where the search Text can be found.

Parameter.name: search
Parameter.description: The Text string to be found.

Parameter.name: startIndex
Parameter.description: Indicates the (zero-based) index where the search starts. In case of searching from the end to the start, a startIndex different from 0 (zero) indicates the end of the text. The default value is 0 (zero). When used in Aggregates this parameter is not present.

Parameter.name: searchFromEnd
Parameter.description: Indicates the direction of the search. In case of searching from the end to the start, a startIndex different from 0 (zero) indicates the end of the text. The default value is False. When used in Aggregates this parameter is not present.

Parameter.name: ignoreCase
Parameter.desription: If set to True, uppercase and lowercase characters are considered to be the same. The default value is False. When used in Aggregates this parameter is not present.

Function.Description: Returns the zero-based position in Text 't' where 'search' Text can be found. Returns -1 if 'search' is not found or if 'search' is empty.
Function.Examples:
Index(""First string"", ""F"") = 0
Index(""First string"", ""st"") = 3
Index(""First string"", ""xx"") = -1
Index(""First string"", ""F"", startIndex: 5) = -1
Index(""First string"", ""st"", startIndex: 5) = 6
Index(""First string"", ""xx"", startIndex: 5) = -1
Index(""First string"", ""F"", searchFromEnd: True) = 0
Index(""First string"", ""st"", searchFromEnd: True) = 6
Index(""First string"", ""xx"", searchFromEnd: True) = -1
Index(""First string"", ""f"") = -1
Index(""First string"", ""f"", ignoreCase: True) = 0
Index("""", ""xx"") = -1
Index(""First string"", """") = -1
Index("""", """") = -1

Function.name: Length
Function.description: Returns the number of characters in Text 't'.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The Text to calculate the length of.

Function.name: NewLine
Function.description: Returns a string containing the New Line (Return) character.

Function.name: Replace
Function.description: Returns Text 't' after replacing all Text occurrences of 'search' with 'replace'.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The Text where the search and replace operation is performed.

Parameter.name: search
Parameter.description: The Text to be replaced.

Parameter.name: replace
Parameter.description: The Text that replaces the search Text.

Function.Examples:
Replace(""First string"", ""xx"", """") = ""First string""
Replace(""First string"", ""First"", ""Second"") = ""Second string""
Replace(""First string"", ""First"", """") = "" string""

Function.name: Substr
Function.description: Returns a sub-string of 't' beginning at 'start' zero-based position and with 'length' characters.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The Text where the operation is performed.

Parameter.name: start
Parameter.description: The zero-based position to start the Text extraction from.

Parameter.name: length
Parameter.description: The number of characters to include in the output Text.

Function.Examples:
Substr(""First string"", 2, 4) = ""rst ""
Substr(""First string"", 0, 100) = ""First string""
Substr(""First string"", 11, 3) = ""g""
Substr(""First string"", Length(""First string""), 0) = """"
Substr(""First string"", 2, 0) = """"

Function.name: ToLower
Function.description: Converts Text 't' to the equivalent lowercase text.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: Thet Text to transform into lowercase.

Function.name: ToUpper
Function.description: Converts Text 't' to the equivalent uppercase text.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The Text to transform into uppercase.

Function.name: Trim
Function.description: Removes all leading and trailing space characters (' ') from Text 't'.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The Text to trim.

Function.name: TrimEnd
Function.description: Removes all trailing space characters (' ') from Text 't'.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The Text to remove trailing space characters from.

Function.Examples:
TrimEnd("" First string "") = "" First string""
TrimEnd(""First string "") = ""First string""

Function.name: TrimStart
Function.description: Removes all leading space characters (' ') from Text 't'.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The Text to remove leading space characters from.

Function.name: AddDays
Function.description: Adds 'n' days to 'dt' and returns a valid Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to add days to.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number of days to add.

Function.name: AddHours
Function.description: Adds 'n' hours to 'dt' and returns a valid Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to add hours to.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number of hours do add.

Function.name: AddMinutes
Function.description: Adds 'n' minutes to 'dt' and returns a valid Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to add minutes to.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number of minutes to add.

Function.name: AddMonths
Function.description: Adds 'n' months to 'dt' and returns a valid Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to add months to.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number of months to add.

Function.name: AddSeconds
Function.description: Adds 'n' seconds to 'dt' and returns a valid Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to add seconds to.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number of seconds to add.

Function.name: AddYears
Function.description: Adds 'n' years to 'dt' and returns a valid Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to add years to.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.description: The number of years to add.

Function.name: BuildDateTime
Function.description: Returns a Date Time made up of the Date 'd' and Time 't'.

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The Date to build the Date Time from.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.descriptino: The Time to build the Date Time from.

Function.name: CurrDate
Function.Description:
In client-side calls, it returns the device date.
In server-side calls, it returns the platform server date.
In query calls, it returns the platform server date.

Function.name: CurrDateTime
Function.Description:
In client-side calls, it returns the device date and time.
In server-side calls, it returns the platform server date and time.
In query calls, it returns the platform server date and time.

Date times in the device are converted in the server to the server time zone.
Conversely, date times in the server are converted in the device to the device time zone.

Function.name: CurrTime
Function.Description:
In client-side calls, it returns the device time.
In server-side calls, it returns the platform server time.
In query calls, it returns the platform server time.

Function.name: Day
Function.description: Returns the day of 'dt'.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to calculate the day from.

Function.name: DayOfWeek
Function.description: Returns the week day of 'dt', ranging from 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday).

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to calculate the day of the week from.

Function.name: DiffDays

Parameter.name: dt1
Parameter.description: The first Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt2
Parameter.description: The second Date Time.

Function.Description:
Returns the difference in days between 'dt1' and 'dt2'; i.e. how many days have passed between these two dates:

- Returns a positive number if 'dt1' is smaller than 'dt2';
- Returns a negative number if 'dt1' is bigger than 'dt2';
- Returns 0 if the two dates are equal.

The Time component you provide in the parameters is ignored. The DiffDays function receives two Date Time parameters, and then replaces the Time component with 00:00:00. It calculates the elapsed time in milliseconds from the first date at 00:00:00 to the second date at 00:00:00, and then converts the difference in milliseconds into days.

Daylight Saving Time (DST) is ignored. The time zone considered for evaluating this function is always the time zone of the Platform Server, regardless of the regional settings of the end-user.

The maximum supported value is (2^31)-1 days. This corresponds to approximately 5879489.8 years. If DiffDays(dt1, dt2) is bigger than (2^31)-1, you will get an unexpected value.
Function.Examples:
DiffDays(#1982-05-19#, #1982-05-21#) = 2
DiffDays(#1982-05-21#, #1982-05-19#) = -2
DiffDays(#2005-05-11 00:00:00#, #2005-05-11 23:59:59#) = 0
DiffDays(#2004-09-01#, #2004-10-01#) = 31
DiffDays(#2004-09-01 23:00:00#, #2004-09-02 00:10:00#) = 1
DiffDays(#2004-09-01 23:00:00#, #2004-09-02 23:30:00#) = 1
DiffDays(#2014-03-30 00:00:00#, #2014-03-31 00:00:00#) = 1, assuming the GMT+1 time zone (2014 Daylight Saving Time starts in Europe on March 30 of 2014). If your server is in a different time zone, you will get different results.
DiffDays(#2014-10-25 00:00:00#, #2014-10-26 00:00:00#) = 1, assuming the GMT+1 time zone (2014 Daylight Saving Time ends in Europe on October 26 of 2014). If your server is in a different time zone, you will get different results.

Function.name: DiffHours

Parameter.name: dt1
Parameter.description: The first Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt2
Parameter.description: The second Date Time.

Function.Description:
Returns the difference in hours between 'dt1' and 'dt2'; i.e. how many hours have passed between these two dates:

- Returns a positive number if 'dt1' is smaller than 'dt2';
- Returns a negative number if 'dt1' is bigger than 'dt2'.
- Returns 0 if the two dates are equal.

Daylight Saving Time (DST) is ignored. The time zone considered for evaluating this function is always the time zone of the Platform Server, regardless of the regional settings of the end-user.

The maximum supported value is (2^31)-1 hours. This corresponds to approximately 244978.74 years. If DiffHours(dt1, dt2) is bigger than (2^31)-1, you will get an unexpected value.
Function.Examples:
DiffHours(#1982-05-21 22:20:30#, #1982-05-22 02:00:00#) = 4
DiffHours(#1982-05-22 02:00:00#, #1982-05-21 22:20:30#) = -4
DiffHours(#2005-05-11 10:59:00#, #2005-05-11 10:00:00#) = 0
DiffHours(#2005-05-11 10:00:00#, #2005-05-12 10:00:00#) = 24
DiffHours(#2005-05-11 10:59:00#, #2005-05-12 15:00:00#) = 29
DiffHours(#2006-03-25 15:00:00#, #2006-03-26 15:00:00#) = 24, assuming the GMT+1 time zone (2006 Daylight Saving Time starts in Europe on March 26 of 2006). If your server is in a different time zone, you will get different results.
DiffHours(#2006-10-28 15:00:00#, #2006-10-29 15:00:00#) = 24, assuming the GMT+1 time zone (2006 Daylight Saving Time ends in Europe on October 29 of 2006). If your server is in a different time zone, you will get different results.

Function.name: DiffMinutes
Function.description: Returns the difference in minutes between 'dt1' and 'dt2'; i.e. how many minutes have between these two dates. Returns a positive number if 'dt1' is smaller than 'dt2'; and returns a negative number if 'dt1' is bigger than 'dt2'.

Parameter.name: dt1
Parameter.description: The first Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt2
Parameter.description: The second Date Time.

Function.Description:
Returns the difference in minutes between 'dt1' and 'dt2'; i.e. how many minutes have passed between these two dates:

- Returns a positive number if 'dt1' is smaller than 'dt2';
- Returns a negative number if 'dt1' is bigger than 'dt2'.
- Returns 0 if the two dates are equal.

Daylight Saving Time (DST) is ignored. The time zone considered for evaluating this function is always the time zone of the Platform Server, regardless of the regional settings of the end-user.

The maximum supported value is (2^31)-1 minutes. This corresponds to approximately 4085.78 years. If DiffMinutes(dt1, dt2) is bigger than (2^31)-1, you will get an unexpected value.
Function.Examples:
DiffMinutes(#1982-05-21 22:20:30#, #1982-05-21 22:26:00#) = 6
DiffMinutes(#1982-05-21 22:26:00#, #1982-05-21 22:20:30#) = -6
DiffMinutes(#1982-05-21 22:26:00#, #1982-05-21 22:26:59#) = 0
DiffMinutes(#1982-05-21 22:26:30#, #1982-05-21 22:27:20#) = 1
DiffMinutes(#1982-05-21 22:26:30#, #1982-05-21 22:27:40#) = 1
DiffMinutes(#2006-05-21 15:00:00#, #2006-05-22 15:00:00#) = 1440
DiffMinutes(#2006-03-25 15:00:00#, #2006-03-26 15:00:00#) = 1440, assuming the GMT+1 time zone (2006 Daylight Saving Time starts in Europe on March 26 of 2006). If your server is in a different time zone, you will get different results.
DiffMinutes(#2006-10-28 15:00:00#, #2006-10-29 15:00:00#) = 1440, assuming the GMT+1 time zone (2006 Daylight Saving Time ends in Europe on October 29 of 2006). If your server is in a different time zone, you will get different results.

Function.name: DiffSeconds
Function.description: Returns the difference in seconds between 'dt1' and 'dt2'; i.e. how many seconds have passed between these two dates. Returns a positive number if 'dt1' is smaller than 'dt2'; and returns a negative number if 'dt1' is bigger than 'dt2'.

Parameter.name: dt1
Parameter.description: The first Date Time.

Parameter.name: dt2
Parameter.description: The second Date Time.

Function.Description:
Returns the difference in seconds between 'dt1' and 'dt2'; i.e. how many seconds have passed between these two dates:

- Returns a positive number if 'dt1' is smaller than 'dt2';
- Returns a negative number if 'dt1' is bigger than 'dt2'.
- Returns 0 if the two dates are equal.

Daylight Saving Time (DST) is ignored. The time zone considered for evaluating this function is always the time zone of the Platform Server, regardless of the regional settings of the end-user.

The maximum supported value is (2^31)-1 seconds. This corresponds to approximately 68.10 years. If DiffSeconds(dt1, dt2) is bigger than (2^31)-1, you will get an unexpected value.
Function.Examples:
DiffSeconds(#1982-05-21 22:20:30#, #1982-05-21 22:21:05#) = 35
DiffSeconds(#1982-05-21 22:21:05#, #1982-05-21 22:20:30#) = -35
DiffSeconds(#2006-05-21 15:00:00#, #2006-05-22 15:00:00#) = 86400
DiffSeconds(#2006-03-25 15:00:00#, #2006-03-26 15:00:00# ) = 86400, assuming the GMT+1 time zone (2006 Daylight Saving Time starts in Europe on March 26 of 2006). If your server is in a different time zone, you will get different results.
DiffSeconds(#2006-10-28 15:00:00#, #2006-10-29 15:00:00#) = 86400, assuming the GMT+1 time zone (2006 Daylight Saving Time ends in Europe on October 29 of 2006). If your server is in a different time zone, you will get different results.

Function.name: Hour
Function.description: Returns the hour of 'dt'.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to extract the hours from.

Function.name: Minute
Function.description: Returns the minute of 'dt'.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to extract the minutes from.

Function.name: Month
Function.description: Returns the month of 'dt'.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to extract the month from.

Function.name: NewDate
Function.description: Returns a Date made up of year 'y', month 'm' and day 'd'.

Parameter.name: y
Parameter.description: The year of the Date.

Parameter.name: m
Parameter.description: The month of the Date.

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The day of the Date.

Function.name: NewDateTime
Function.description: Returns a Date Time made up of year 'y', month 'mo', day 'd', hour 'h', minute 'mi' and second 's'.

Parameter.name: y
Parameter.description: The year of the Date Time.

Parameter.name: mo
Parameter.description: The month of the Date Time.

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The day of the Date Time.

Parameter.name: h
Parameter.description: The hours of the Date Time.

Parameter.name: mi
Parameter.description: The minutes of the Date Time.

Parameter.name: s
Parameter.description: The seconds of the Date Time.

Function.name: NewTime
Function.description: Returns a Time made up of hour 'h', minute 'm' and second 's'.

Parameter.name: h
Parameter.description: The hours of the Time.

Parameter.name: m
Parameter.description: The minutes of the Time.

Parameter.name: s
Parameter.description: The seconds of the Time.

Function.name: Second
Function.description: Returns the seconds of 'dt'.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to extract the seconds from.

Function.name: Year
Function.description: Returns the year of 'dt'.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The Date Time to extract the year from.

Function.name: BooleanToInteger
Function.description: Converts Boolean 'b' to an Integer value, either 1 if 'b' is True or 0 if 'b' is False.

Parameter.name: b
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: BooleanToText
Function.description: Converts Boolean 'b' to a Text value, either "True" or "False".

Parameter.name: b
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DateTimeToDate
Function.description: Converts Date Time 'dt' to a Date value dropping the Time component.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DateTimeToText
Function.description: Converts Date Time 'dt' to a Text value in the format specified in the environment configuration (by default, "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss").

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DateTimeToTime
Function.description: Converts Date Time 'dt' to a Time value dropping the Date component.

Parameter.name: dt
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DateToDateTime
Function.description: Converts Date 'd' to a Date Time value, adding the Time component (#00:00:00#).

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DateToText
Function.description: Converts Date 'd' to a Text value in the format specified in the environment configuration (by default, "yyyy-MM-dd").

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DecimalToBoolean
Function.description: Converts Decimal 'd' to a Boolean value. Decimal value of 0.0 is False. Any other value is True.

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DecimalToInteger

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Description:
Converts Decimal 'd' to an Integer value.
In client-side and server-side logic, the function rounds the input using the round half to even method. In Aggregate expressions the function truncates to the integer part of the input.
To check if the conversion is possible you can use the DecimalToIntegerValidate function.
Function.Examples:
When used in client-side and server-side logic:
DecimalToInteger(134.2) = 134
DecimalToInteger(134.5) = 134
DecimalToInteger(133.5) = 134
DecimalToInteger(134.7) = 135
DecimalToInteger(134) = 134
DecimalToInteger(12345678999.9) = 0

When used in Aggregates:
DecimalToInteger(134.2) = 134
DecimalToInteger(134.5) = 134
DecimalToInteger(133.5) = 133
DecimalToInteger(134.7) = 134
DecimalToInteger(134) = 134
DecimalToInteger(12345678999.9) = Arithmetic Overflow Error

Function.name: DecimalToIntegerValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Decimal 'd' can be converted to an Integer value.

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DecimalToLongInteger

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Description:
Converts Decimal 'd' to a Long Integer value.
In client-side and server-side logic, the function rounds the input using the round half to even method. In Aggregate expressions the function truncates to the integer part of the input.
To check if the conversion is possible you can use the DecimalToLongIntegerValidate function.
Function.Examples:
When used in client-side and server-side logic:
DecimalToLongInteger(134.2) = 134
DecimalToLongInteger(134.5) = 134
DecimalToLongInteger(133.5) = 134
DecimalToLongInteger(134.7) = 135
DecimalToLongInteger(134) = 134
DecimalToLongInteger(157898999999988844444.2) = 0

When used in Aggregates:
DecimalToLongInteger(134.2) = 134
DecimalToLongInteger(134.5) = 134
DecimalToLongInteger(133.5) = 133
DecimalToLongInteger(134.7) = 134
DecimalToLongInteger(134) = 134
DecimalToLongInteger(157898999999988844444.2) = Arithmetic Overflow Error

Function.name: DecimalToLongIntegerValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Decimal 'd' can be converted to a Long Integer value.

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: DecimalToText
Function.description: Converts Decimal 'd' to a Text value.

Parameter.name: d
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: LongIntegerToInteger
Function.description: Converts Long Integer 'l' to an Integer value. If 'l' is outside the boundaries of the Integer values, the function will return the Integer default value. To check if the conversion is possible you can use the LongIntegerToIntegerValidate function.

Parameter.name: l
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: LongIntegerToIntegerValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Long Integer 'l' can be converted to an Integer value.

Parameter.name: l
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: LongIntegerToIdentifier
Function.description: Converts Long Integer 'l' to a Long Integer Identifier.

Parameter.name: l
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: LongIntegerToText
Function.description: Converts Long Integer 'l' to a Text value.

Parameter.name: l
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: IdentifierToInteger
Function.description: Converts Identifier 'Id' to an Integer value.

Parameter.name: id
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Examples: IdentifierToInteger(GetUserId()) = 504 (the result may be different in your module)

Function.name: IdentifierToLongInteger
Function.description: Converts Identifier 'Id' to a Long Integer value.

Parameter.name: id
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Examples: IdentifierToLongInteger(GetUserId()) = 30 (the result may be different in your module)

Function.name: IdentifierToText
Function.description: Converts Identifier 'Id' to a Text value.

Parameter.name: id
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Examples: IdentifierToText(GetUserId()) = ""30"" (the result may be different in your module)

Function.name: IntegerToBoolean
Function.description: Converts Integer 'i' to a Boolean value. Boolean value of 0 is False. Any other value is True.

Parameter.name: i
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: IntegerToDecimal
Function.description: Converts Integer 'i' to a Decimal value.

Parameter.name: i
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: IntegerToIdentifier
Function.description: Converts Integer 'i' to an Integer Identifier.

Parameter.name: i
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: IntegerToText
Function.description: Converts Integer 'i' to a Text value.

Parameter.name: i
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: NullDate
Function.description: Returns a null Date value.

Function.name: NullIdentifier
Function.description: Returns a null Identifier valid for Integer and Long Integer Identifiers.

Function.name: NullObject
Function.description: Returns a null Object value.

Function.name: NullBinary
Function.description: Returns a null Binary Data value.

Function.name: NullTextIdentifier
Function.description: Returns a null Text Identifier.

Function.name: TextToDate

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Description:
Converts Text 't' to a Date value.
If 't' can't be converted to a valid Date value, the function will return the Date default value. To check if the conversion is possible you can use the TextToDateValidate function.
You should check the limits of the Date data type. You should also ensure that the date you type in the argument complies with the default date format (yyyy-mm-dd, yyyy/mm/dd, and yyyy.mm.dd) or the servers environment configuration.

Function.name: TextToDateTime

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Description:
Converts Text 't' to a Date Time value.
If 't' can't be converted to a valid Date Time value, the function will return a Date Time default value. To check if the conversion is possible you can use the TextToDateTimeValidate function.
You should check the limits of the Date Time data type. You should also ensure that the Date Time you type in the argument complies with the default Date Time format (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss, yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss, and yyyy.mm.dd hh:mm:ss) or the servers environment configuration.

Function.name: TextToDateTimeValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Text 't' can be converted to a Date Time value.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: TextToDateValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Text 't' can be converted to a Date value.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: TextToDecimal
Function.description: Converts Text 't' to a Decimal value. The only allowed decimal separator is the ".". If 't' is outside the boundaries of the Decimal values, the function will return the Decimal default value. To check if the conversion is possible you can use the TextToDecimalValidate function.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: TextToDecimalValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Text 't' can be converted to a Decimal value.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: TextToIdentifier
Function.description: Converts Text 't' to a Text Identifier.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: TextToInteger

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Description:
Converts Text 't' to an Integer value.
If 't' is outside the boundaries of the Integer values the function will return an Integer default value. To check if the conversion is possible you can use the TextToIntegerValidate function.

Function.name: TextToLongInteger

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Description:
Converts Text 't' to a Long Integer value.
If 't' is outside the boundaries of the Long Integer values the function will return a Long Integer default value. To check if the conversion is possible you can use the TextToLongIntegerValidate function.

Function.name: TextToIntegerValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Text 't' can be converted to an Integer value.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: TextToLongIntegerValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Text 't' can be converted to a Long Integer value.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: TextToTime

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.Description:
Converts Text 't' to a Time value.
If 't' can't be converted to a valid Time value, the function will return the Time default value. To check if the conversion is possible you can use the TextToTimeValidate function.
You should check the limits of the Time data type. You should also ensure that the Time you type in the argument complies with the Time format (hh:mm:ss).

Function.name: TextToTimeValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Text 't' can be converted to a Time value.

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: TimeToText
Function.description: Converts Time 't' to a Text value in the format "HH:mm:ss".

Parameter.name: t
Parameter.description: The value to be converted

Function.name: ToObject
Function.description: Converts expression 'exp' to an Object value.

Parameter.name: exp
Parameter.description: The element to be converted

Function.name: FormatCurrency

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.description: The Currency value to be formatted.

Parameter.name: symbol
Parameter.description: The currency symbol.

Parameter.name: decimal_digits
Parameter.description: The number of decimal digits.

Parameter.name: decimal_separator
Parameter.description: The decimal separator symbol.

Parameter.name: group_separator
Parameter.description: The group separator symbol.

Function.Description:
Builds a Text output of the specified Currency 'value', preceded by the currency 'symbol', using 'decimal_digits' after the decimal point. The decimal point is specified using 'decimal_separator', while the thousands can be separated with the 'group_separator'.

When rounding, the function behaves differently depending on where you use it:

- In the application server, it applies the method round half up (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds up).
- In client-side logic, it applies the method round half to even (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds to the nearest even integer).

Function.name: FormatDecimal

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.description: The Decimal value to be formatted.

Parameter.name: decimal_digits
Parameter.description: The number of decimal digitis.

Parameter.name: decimal_separator
Parameter.description: The decimal separator symbol.

Parameter.name: group_separator
Parameter.description: The group separator symbol.

Function.Description:
Builds a Text output of the specified Decimal 'value', using 'decimal_digits' after the decimal point. The decimal point is specified using 'decimal_separator', while the thousands can be separated with the 'group_separator'.

When rounding, the function behaves differently depending on where you use it:

- In the application server, it applies the method round half up (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds up).
- In client-side logic, it applies the method round half to even (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds to the nearest even integer).

Function.name: FormatPercent

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.description: The Decimal value to format as a percentage.

Parameter.name: decimal_digits
Parameter.description: The number of decimal digits to use.

Parameter.name: decimal_separator
Parameter.description: The symbol to use as decimal separator.

Function.Description:
Builds a Text output of the specified Decimal 'value', followed by '%' using 'decimal_digits' after the decimal point. The decimal point is specified using 'decimal_separator'.

When rounding, the function behaves differently depending on where you use it:

- In the application server, it applies the method round half up (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds up).
- In client-side logic, it applies the method round half to even (rounds to the nearest integer, 0.5 rounds to the nearest even integer).
Function.Examples:
FormatPercent(0.12, 3, ""#"") = ""12#000%""
FormatPercent(0.124, 0, "","") = ""12%""
FormatPercent(0.125, 0, "","") = ""13%"" (in the application server) or ""12%"" (in client-side logic)
FormatPercent(0.1251, 0, "","") = ""13%""
FormatPercent(0.135, 0, "","") = ""14%""
FormatPercent(12345.6789, 2, "","") = ""1234567,89%""
FormatPercent(-12345.6789, 2, "","") = ""-1234567,89%""

Function.name: FormatPhoneNumber
Function.description: Builds a Text output of the specified phone number Text 'value', starting with the international separator 'int_separator', followed by the first 'int_code_digits' of 'value', then the 'area_separator', then the following 'area_code_digits' of 'value', then the 'phone_separator' and finally the following 'phone_digits' of 'value'.

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.description: The phone number to be formatted.

Parameter.name: int_code_digits
Parameter.description: The number of digits composing the international code.

Parameter.name: area_code_digits
Parameter.description: The number of digits composing the area code.

Parameter.name: phone_digits
Parameter.description: The number of digitis composing the phone number without international or area codes.

Parameter.name: int_separator
Parameter.description: The symbol for the international code.

Parameter.name: area_separator
Parameter.description: The symbol to use as separator between the international code and the area code.

Parameter.name: phone_separator
Parameter.description: The symbol to use as separator between the area code and the phone number.

Function.name: FormatText
Function.description: Builds a Text output of the specified Text 'value', by limiting it to the specified 'max_chars' count. If 'value' has less than the 'min_chars' characters limit, enough 'padding_char' characters are added to expand the length to that limit. In this case, 'left_padding' determines where the padding should be added.

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.description: The Text to be formatted.

Parameter.name: min_chars
Parameter.description: The minimum number of characters in the output.

Parameter.name: max_chars
Parameter.description: The maximum number of characters in the output.

Parameter.name: left_padding
Parameter.description: Indicates in which side the Text is padded.

Parameter.name: padding_char
Parameter.description: The character to use for padding the string to the minimum length.

Function.name: FormatDateTime

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.description: The Date Time to be formatted.

Parameter.name: format
Parameter.description: The formatting pattern.

Function.Description:
Builds a Text output of the specified Date Time 'value' using the specified 'format'. Formatting pattern can be any combination of the following:
Day:
- d: day without leading zero;
- dd: day WITH leading zero;
- ddd: abbreviated day name;
- dddd: full day name;
Month:
- M: month without leading zero;
- MM: month WITH leading zero;
- MMM: abbreviated month name;
- MMMM: full month name;
Year:
- y: last one or two digits of the year;
- yy: last two digits of the year;
- yyyy: year;
Hour:
- h: hour from 0 to 12 without leading zero;
- hh: hour from 0 to 12 WITH leading zero;
- H: hour from 0 to 24 without leading zero;
- HH: hour from 0 to 24 WITH leading zero;
Minute:
- m: minutes without leading zero;
- mm: minutes WITH leading zero;
Second:
- s: seconds without leading zero;
- ss: seconds WITH leading zero;
AM Designator:
- t: first letter of AM or PM;
- tt: AM or PM.

If you want to output any of these characters then precede it with '\'.
Changing the environment date format does not change the way the FormatDateTime function formats the dates.
Function.Examples:
FormatDateTime(#2015-06-09 10:05:20#, ""ddd, dd MMM yyyy"") = ""Tue, 09 Jun 2015""
FormatDateTime(CurrDateTime(),""To\da\y i\s: dddd"") = ""Today is: Tuesday""

Function.name: EmailAddressCreate

Parameter.name: name
Parameter.description: The display name of the email address which usually is the name of the email address owner as, for example, "John Smith".

Parameter.name: email
Parameter.description: The email address itself, for example, john.smith@worldmail.com.

Function.Description:
Returns a full email address string containing the display name (usually it's the name of the email address owner) and the email address itself. The resulting full email address may then be used in the Send Email element (action flows) or in the Send Email activity (process flows).
To build a list of email addresses use the EmailAddressesConcatenate built-in function.

Function.name: EmailAddressesConcatenate
Function.description: Returns the concatenation of email addresses, or list of email addresses, into a a new list of email addresses separated by a comma (','). The resulting list may then be used in the Send Email element (action flows) or in the Send Email activity (process flows).

Parameter.name: address1
Parameter.description: The email address or email addresses list

Parameter.name: address2
Parameter.description: The email address or email addresses list

Function.name: EmailAddressValidate
Function.description: Returns true if Text 'address' is a valid email address

Parameter.name: address
Parameter.description: The email address to validate.

Function.name: GetApplicationServerType
Function.description: Returns ".Net".

Function.name: GetCurrentLocale
Function.description: Returns the name of the current language locale of the user session. The name of the language locale is used for presentation purposes and follows the RFC 1766 standard format.

Function.name: GetDatabaseProvider
Function.description: Returns the type of the Platform Database (SqlServer, Oracle or MySQL) where the module is running.

Function.name: GetUserAgent
Function.description: Returns the user agent, as indicated by the header of the HTTP message.
Function.Examples:
GetUserAgent() = ""Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/49.0.2623.87 Safari/537.36""
GetUserAgent() = ""Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko""

Function.name: GetOwnerEspaceIdentifier
Function.description: Returns the identifier of the module that owns the element that is being processed.

Function.name: GetEntryEspaceName
Function.description: Returns the name of the module that is processing the web request.

Function.name: GetEntryEspaceId
Function.description: Returns the identifier of the module that is processing the web request.

Function.name: GetObsoleteTenantId
Function.description: Method to return a fake tenant identifier for single-tenant modules in order to mimic Site.TenantId semantic from the 6.0 version

Function.name: AddPersonalAreaToURLPath

Parameter.name: url
Parameter.description: The url to add the personal area path to.

Function.Description:
Returns a string where the Personal Area is added (if applicable) to the URL path set in Text 't' input parameter. This function enables you to run any page (or resource) of your module in the Personal Area without having to manually change their paths.
This function adds the Personal Area of the developer that is running the module to the URL path provided by the input parameter.
Function.Examples:
Consider that Dave Lauper is running the Customers module in his Personal Area and that his username is 'dlauper':
AddPersonalAreaToURLPath(""/Customers/ListCustomers.aspx"") = ""/Customers/dlauper/ListCustomers.aspx""
AddPersonalAreaToURLPath(""http://myserverat.outsystemscloud.com/Customers/ListCustomers.aspx"") = ""http://myserverat.outsystemscloud.com/Customers/dlauper/ListCustomers.aspx""

In this next example the same developer is running the module in the public area:
AddPersonalAreaToURLPath(""/Customers/ListCustomers.aspx"") = ""/Customers/ListCustomers.aspx""

Function.name: GetBookmarkableURL
Function.Description:
Returns the URL of the screen that is currently being processed.
The URL returned by this function is a complete URL with the format http://server/module/personal_area/screen?param1=value&param2=value...
Parameters and their values aren't included when parameters are optional and their values aren't set.

Function.name: GetPersonalAreaName
Function.description: Returns the name of the Personal Area where the module is currently running.
Function.Examples:
Consider that Dave Lauper is running the Customers module in his Personal Area and that his username is 'dlauper':
GetPersonalAreaName() = ""dlauper""

Function.name: GetOwnerURLPath
Function.description: Returns the URL path of the module that owns the element that is being processed. Note that this function does not return the complete URL but only the component containing the location of the resource within the domain and, if applicable, the personal area.

Function.name: GetExceptionURL
Function.description: Returns the absolute URL of the screen where the last exception was raised.

Function.name: GeneratePassword
Function.description: Generates and returns a password string of length 'l'. If 'alpha' is True the string can contain both digits and letters, if False the string can only contain digits. The generated password string is a random combination of letters and digits, or just digits, depending on 'alpha'.

Parameter.name: l
Parameter.description: The length of the Text string to be generated.

Parameter.name: alpha
Parameter.description: Indicates if the generated Text string can contain digits and letters or digits only.

Function.name: If

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.description: The condition to be evaluated.

Parameter.name: true_return
Parameter.description: The expression to be evaluated and returned when the condition is true.

Parameter.name: false_return
Parameter.description: The expression to be evaluated and returned when the condition is false.

Function.Description:
Returns 'true_return' if 'value' is True, otherwise returns 'false_return'.
The return data type of the function is the type of 'true_return' unless there's an implicit conversion from 'true_return' type to 'false_return' type.
When there's no implicit type conversion an invalid data type error will occur.
Function.Examples:
If(countVar = 0, 0, 1/countVar) = 0 when countVar is 0 or 1/countVar when countVar is different from 0.
If(True, 2.34, ""xpto"") = ""2.34""
If(False, ""xpto"", #2016-05-02#) = ""2016-05-02""
If(False, #2015-05-02#, #2016-05-02#) = #2016-05-02#
If(False, 2.34, #2016-05-02#) = Invalid Data Type error.

Function.name: IsLoadingScreen
Function.description: Returns true only when invoked within a screen Preparation execution and only if the screen is loading its content. Otherwise, if the screen is just being redrawn, i.e. posted back, it returns False.

Function.name: CurrentThemeIsMobile
Function.description: Returns true when the current web screen is using a mobile theme.

Function.name: CheckRole
Function.description: Returns true when the given user has the specific role.

Parameter.name: RoleId
Parameter.description: The identifier of the role to be validated.

Parameter.name: UserId
Parameter.description: The identifier of the user for which to validate if role is granted.

Function.name: GetUserId
Function.description: Returns the identifier of the user that is currently authenticated with the server or 'NullIdentifier()' if the user is not authenticated.
